results.title: After Beardsley
results.brief_description: In this film, contemporary or near contemporary figures like John Lennon and Lenny Bruce help demonstrate a hypothetical Beardsley picture of the 1980s.

results.title: Aerodynamics: Forces acting on an air foil
results.brief_description: Explains the theory and principles of forces acting on air foils. Tells of the development and use of wind tunnels to measure forces on wing form.

results.title: Advertising: a mixed blessing
results.brief_description: Examines why advertisers use certain images; how agencies select their target consumer groups; jobs created within the advertising industry; the way in which images are purveyed on billboards, T-shirts, trucks, trains; prestige advertising.

results.title: Adventures in perception
results.creator_credit: Han Van Gelder and Han Van Gelder Filmproducktie N V
results.brief_description: Depicts the art works of Dutch artist Murits Escher, who creates illusions of shape by the use in his painting, drawing, sculpture etc. of such devices of mirror imagery, repetition, metamorphosis and geometric design.

results.title: Slide fasteners
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sewing”.
Shows how to set in slide fasteners; explains why the concealed side openings in dresses and skirts are purposely designed for the side of the garment, and why in others the opening is made in the centre front, or centre back.

results.title: Pattern interpretation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sewing”.
Discusses such problems as the interpretation of markings on various well-known commercial patterns; how to determine pattern size, yardage required, and the interpretation of pattern instructions.

results.title: Advanced seams
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sewing”.
Demonstrates the procedure for the following seams: French; slot; flat well; welt; tucked; and piped.

results.title: Simple seams
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sewing”.
Demonstrates the procedures for preparing plain seams with the edges pinked; edges overcast; edges stitched; edges bound; edges catch-stitched; and the edges top-stitched. In each case the procedure for pressing the seam is demonstrated.
